body:
Well, if any of you guys didn't know, I run this small youtube channel called BlackSniperPvP. Basically I started when I was shiet at pretty much everything. Recently, I've got better after I figured out what the sprint key does (after some confusion xP). Last week, I did his kinda cool montage with both nexus and nebula which went pretty well. What I'm asking is that, is you haven't already, to subscribe for the following reasons. 1. When I wake up on a Saturday morning, I really can't be bother to do a vid for my 15 subscribers. 2. It gives me more of an incentive to be epic at pvp! 3. When we get to like 50 subs I'll do a giveaway! Cheers guys
PEACE!! <3
body_tagged:

replies.body:
What the heck's wrong with you? 
Seriously. You do Youtube because it's fun, unless you're someone who has no other skills and has to do it for a living. 

Seriously, if you don't get subs, don't do Youtube. 
Those small youtubers do Youtube because they like it, not cause they want subscribers... 
Just stop. Please. If your attitude is this, there's really no point...

replies.body:
Don't take this as hate, I only want to help.

Please, do not beg for subs. I know how it feels not having the motivation to make a video. I started posting videos when I was in 5th grade and I did purely for fun. It may have taken me 2 years (enough time for some people to have reached thousands of subs) but I am now at just under 100 subs. I am perfectly happy catering to my small but supportive fanbase. I make videos to show others what I can do, and because it is enjoyable. I never advertised or begged because I knew from the start it was a selfish and foolish thing to do. I suggest you take it easy and post at a leisurely pace. Post videos of Avicus and share it with us; I'm sure we will enjoy it. :)

P.S. Typing on a phone in a car is hard :P
